alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 08 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...and northern New Jersey... including the following counties...in central New Jersey...Mercer and Monmouth. In northern New Jersey...Middlesex. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 456 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Middletown, Old Bridge, East Brunswick, Princeton, Matawan, Jamesburg, Cranbury, Whittingham, Clearbrook Park, Dayton, Princeton Meadows, and Morganville. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 9. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 66 and 71. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 115 and 119. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
